results.title: House in the jungle
results.brief_description: Follows the journey of a group of peasants from central Java to a new settlement in Sumatra in an official migration scheme, showing some of Indonesia’s national problems of economic and political life incidentally.

results.title: The House and the sun
results.brief_description: Illustrates the use of solar energy in housing. Animated sequences and commentary describe the principles underlying the use of the glasshouse effect, solar energy collecting panels, while selected projects illustrate the practice.
results.description: Illustrates the use of solar energy in housing. Animated sequences and commentary describe the principles underlying the use of the glasshouse effect, solar energy collecting panels, while selected projects illustrate the practice.

results.title: A Career in hotels and restaurants
results.brief_description: The hotel and restaurant business as a career: a visit by two young people to a hotel where the manager greets them and shows them all the departments, explaining the background for every job and the prospects for entrants. Encourages school leavers to ask if they too can visit a local hotel and look behind the scenes.

results.title: Hot earth
results.brief_description: Rotorua is famous for its geysers which every year attract many tourists. This film shows how a geyser works, tracing the cycle of its operation. Today, research is being carried into geothermal power, in an attempt to harness it for industrial use.
results.description: Rotorua is famous for its geysers which every year attract many tourists. This film shows how a geyser works, tracing the cycle of its operation. Today, research is being carried into geothermal power, in an attempt to harness it for industrial use.

results.title: Hospital team in action
results.creator_credit: Michael Luke, Anne Balfour Fraser and Samaritan Films
results.brief_description: Through the story of a boy who develops osteomyelitis, and the work of the hospital team which attends him, illustrates the varied skills which together contribute to the healing work of any large hospital.

results.title: Hospital sepsis: a communicable disease
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Johnson and Johnson
results.brief_description: Reaffirms the need for stringent precautions against infection in hospitals in face of the present over-reliance on antibiotics. After briefly tracing the history of anti-sepsis in hospitals, a detailed case study of the spread of bacteria from an infected patient pinpoints the major spreaders, reservoirs and multipliers or organisms.

results.title: The Individual
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Instructions in methods of preventing communicable diseases associated with improper food handling. Illustrates habits that should be avoided by cooks and waitresses including dirty clothes and hands, untidy hair, and handling of the eating surface of crockery and cutlery.

results.title: Serving food
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Emphasises principles of food preparation and service in hospitals - proper temperature, correct quality, selection of food to meet patient’s requirements, and courteous attention buy food service personnel.

results.title: Introduction
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Introduces some main features of hospital food organisation: varied deparments, their equipment, and the over-all system of menu planning. Shows the general arrangements of food preparation used in hospitals.

results.title: Equipment

results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Instructions on how to clean kitchen equipment; loosen, dissolve and emulsify dirt; rinse and dry equipment; and prevent food poisoning.
